ruleset.task_description: Label headlines related to central bank independence and related statements with degrees of support, neutrality, criticism, or unrelatedness.

rules.description: Headlines mildly supportive or respectful of central bank independence or mildly neutral statements about Fed actions; showing respect or mild affirmation without strong emphasis or praise.
indicators: fed picks will have broad support

rules.description: Headlines indicating respect or moderate support for central bank independence, including affirmations of independence without strong emphasis, warnings against undermining independence, and statements showing trust or respect for the institution.

Headlines strongly praising or emphasizing the crucial importance of central bank independence, using strong positive or reverent language, or explicitly stating refusal to comment on monetary policy as a sign of respect.
indicators: refusal to comment on monetary policy out of respect
strong praise for central bank leadership

rules.description: Headlines unrelated or neutral with no direct reference or opinion on central bank independence; includes statements about individuals, unrelated economic topics, or general news without central bank context.
indicators: general economic news unrelated to fed
comments on individuals unrelated to fed independence
statements about other economic topics without fed reference

rules.description: Neutral headlines reporting on central bank actions, announcements, or economic conditions without expressing support or criticism; includes routine statements, policy announcements, or factual reporting without opinion on independence.
indicators: fed on path to soft landing

rules.description: Headlines mildly corrosive or mildly critical of central bank independence; expressing mild dissatisfaction, calls for rate cuts, or mild criticism without harsh language or threats.

Headlines moderately corrosive or critical of central bank independence; expressing stronger criticism, blaming Fed for economic problems, calling for significant policy changes or explicitly stating failures.
Headlines strongly corrosive of central bank independence; explicitly attacking independence, threatening removal of officials, or harshly criticizing leadership with strong language.

general_guidelines: Label should be assigned based on the overall sentiment and content of the headline towards central bank independence and policy.
If the headline expresses strong support, use negative labels with magnitude indicating strength (-3 strongest).
Neutral factual reporting without opinion should be labeled 0.
Mild to strong criticism should be labeled with positive values 1 to 3 based on severity.
Use -9999 for unrelated headlines or those not discussing central bank independence or policy.
When in doubt, consider the presence of indicators and the context of the statement.

ruleset.task_description: Label headlines related to central bank independence and related statements with degrees of support, neutrality, criticism, or unrelatedness.

rules.description: Headlines mildly supportive or respectful of central bank independence or mildly neutral statements about Fed actions; showing respect or mild affirmation without strong emphasis or praise.
indicators: fed picks will have broad support

rules.description: Headlines indicating respect or moderate support for central bank independence, including affirmations of independence without strong emphasis, warnings against undermining independence, and statements showing trust or respect for the institution.

Headlines strongly praising or emphasizing the crucial importance of central bank independence, using strong positive or reverent language, or explicitly stating refusal to comment on monetary policy as a sign of respect.
indicators: refusal to comment on monetary policy out of respect
strong praise for central bank leadership

rules.description: Headlines unrelated or neutral with no direct reference or opinion on central bank independence; includes statements about individuals, unrelated economic topics, or general news without central bank context.
indicators: general economic news unrelated to fed
comments on individuals unrelated to fed independence
statements about other economic topics without fed reference

rules.description: Neutral headlines reporting on central bank actions, announcements, or economic conditions without expressing support or criticism; includes routine statements, policy announcements, or factual reporting without opinion on independence.
indicators: fed on path to soft landing

rules.description: Headlines mildly corrosive or mildly critical of central bank independence; expressing mild dissatisfaction, calls for rate cuts, or mild criticism without harsh language or threats.

Headlines moderately corrosive or critical of central bank independence; expressing stronger criticism, blaming Fed for economic problems, calling for significant policy changes or explicitly stating failures.
Headlines strongly corrosive of central bank independence; explicitly attacking independence, threatening removal of officials, or harshly criticizing leadership with strong language.

general_guidelines: Label should be assigned based on the overall sentiment and content of the headline towards central bank independence and policy.
If the headline expresses strong support, use negative labels with magnitude indicating strength (-3 strongest).
Neutral factual reporting without opinion should be labeled 0.
Mild to strong criticism should be labeled with positive values 1 to 3 based on severity.
Use -9999 for unrelated headlines or those not discussing central bank independence or policy.
When in doubt, consider the presence of indicators and the context of the statement.
